```{r}
library(palmerpenguins)#install.packages("palmerpenguins")
library(tidyverse)
```

## Data

Here, we will explore and visualize data collected from the Palmer Station in Antarctica. The data set contains data from three different penguin species: Chinstrap, Adelie, and Gentoo.

![](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/reference/figures/lter_penguins.png)

## Single trait distribution

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, color = species))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_col(mapping = aes(x = species, y = bill_length_mm))
```

## Relationship between multiple traits

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = sex)) +
  facet_wrap(~species)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, color = species))
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_col(mapping = aes(x = body_mass_g, y = flipper_length_mm, fill = species))
```

## Sexual dimorphism

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_point(mapping = aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = island)) +
  facet_wrap(~sex)
```

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_density(mapping = aes(x = body_mass_g, fill = sex)) +
  facet_wrap(~species)
```
